intro: Statice minuta var. cancellata, commonly known as the lace pink or dwarf statice, is a small flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in dried flower arrangements. The varietal name 'cancellata' refers to the finely veined, lacy appearance of its leaves.
